class=update-banner><p>Update available - <a href="" id=update>click here to reload</a></p></div><header class="wrapper site-header" role=banner><div class=container><nav><ul class=site-nav><li class="nav__item logo"><a href="/" class=nav-link><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-wordmark></use></svg></a></li><li class=nav__item><a href=/docs class=nav-link>Documentation</a></li><li class="nav__item nav__item--right"><a href=https://github.com/Browsersync/browser-sync class=nav-link title="Browsersync on Github"><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-github></use></svg></a> <a href=https://twitter.com/browsersync class=nav-link title="@Browsersync on Twitter"><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-twitter></use></svg></a></li></ul></nav></div></header><section class="wrapper intro"><div class=container><svg class="svg-icon logo logo--large"><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-logo></use></svg><h1 class=hook>Time-saving synchronised browser testing.</h1><p class=ronseal>It’s wicked-fast and totally free.</p><p class=video><a class=video__link href=#></a></p><p class=how-to></p><p class=how-to__command>npm install -g browser-sync</p><p class=cta><a class="button button--primary" href=#install title="Get Started">Get Started</a></p><div class=player><p>'bonjour</p></div></div></section></div><div class=site-body role=main><section class="wrapper overview"><div class=container><div class=usp><div class=usp__content><h2 class=usp__title>Your indispensable test assistant.</h2><p>With each web page, device and browser, testing time grows exponentially. From live reloads to URL pushing, form replication to click mirroring, Browsersync cuts out repetitive manual tasks. It’s like an extra pair of hands. Customise an array of sync settings from the UI or command line to create a personalised test environment. Need more control? Browsersync is easily integrated with your web platform, build tools, and other Node.js projects.</p></div><div class=usp__thumb><img src=https://d33wubrfki0l68.cloudfront.net/57e5a9c6538fd243f9300267d4531b7a43696dbb/0ae15/img/ezgif.com-optimize.gif alt=""></div><div class=usp__platforms><img src=https://d33wubrfki0l68.cloudfront.net/d0c72b361b77a4fc0b68e1814208b7ad5b1027ac/aeb41/img/platforms.png alt=""></div></div></div></section><section class="wrapper integrations"><div class=container><p class=integrations__text>Works stand-alone, or integrates with your current build tools</p><img src=https://d33wubrfki0l68.cloudfront.net/bf42b3ae1c1726819ab2727c7412f9513e096579/ab19d/img/build-tools.png class=integrations__thumb alt=""></div></section><section class="wrapper features"><div class=container><h2 class=section-title>Awesome Features</h2><div class=feature__list><div class=feature__item><div class=feature__content><div class=feature__title><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-check></use></svg><h3>Install and run anywhere</h3></div><p>Built on Node.JS_ENTRY to support Windows, MacOS and Linux. Setup in less than 5 minutes.</p></div></div><div class=feature__item><div class=feature__content><div class=feature__title><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-creative-commons-noncommercial-us></use></svg><h3>Free to run and reuse</h3></div><p>Browsersync is an open source project available to use under the Apache 2.0 License.</p></div></div><div class=feature__item><div class=feature__content><div class=feature__title><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-back-in-time></use></svg><h3>Build-tool compatible</h3></div><p>Easily integrated with task runners like Grunt and Gulp, or included in other Node projects.</p></div></div><div class=feature__item><div class=feature__content><div class=feature__title><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-time-slot></use></svg><h3>Network Throttle</h3></div><p>Test your website against a slower connection. Even when devices are connected to wifi.</p></div></div><div class=feature__item><div class=feature__content><div class=feature__title><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-merge></use></svg><h3>Interaction sync</h3></div><p>Your scroll, click, refresh and form actions are mirrored between browsers while you test.</p></div></div><div class=feature__item><div class=feature__content><div class=feature__title><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-text></use></svg><h3>File sync</h3></div><p>Browsers are automatically updated as you change HTML, CSS, images and other project files.</p></div></div><div class=feature__item><div class=feature__content><div class=feature__title><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-tv></use></svg><h3>UI or CLI control</h3></div><p>Run the new browser-based UI for quick control, or stick with the original command line usage.</p></div></div><div class=feature__item><div class=feature__content><div class=feature__title><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-block></use></svg><h3>Sync customisation</h3></div><p>Toggle individual sync settings to create your preferred test environment.</p></div></div><div class=feature__item><div class=feature__content><div class=feature__title><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-list></use></svg><h3>URL history</h3></div><p>Records your test URLs so you can push them back out to all devices with a single click.</p></div></div></div></div></section><section class="wrapper jh"><div class=container><h3 class=jh__title>Depended on by thousands</h3><p class=jh__text>Browsersync is an open-source project with over 2 million npm downloads a month and is a dependency of nearly a <a href="https://github.com/BrowserSync/browser-sync/network/dependents?package_id=UGFja2FnZS0xMzgxNjkyNg%3D%3D" title="Dependants Browsersync on Github">million</a> separate projects on github.</p><p class=jh__links><a href=https://github.com/Browsersync/browser-sync title="Browsersync on Github"><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-github></use></svg></a> <a href=https://twitter.com/browsersync title="@Browsersync on Twitter"><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-twitter></use></svg></a></p></div></section><section class="wrapper wrapper--alt users"><div class=container><h2 class=section-title>Tried and trusted.</h2><div class=user__list><div class=user__logo><img src=https://d33wubrfki0l68.cloudfront.net/5c18baaa5343a8a3bda3f64dd22bd5a9fc15bfb6/616e6/img/user-paravel.png alt="Paravel uses Browsersync"></div><div class="user__logo google"><img src=https://d33wubrfki0l68.cloudfront.net/e603dff84ebdea2177576553ab50867dd98612bc/4ae86/img/user-google.png alt="Google uses Browsersync"></div><div class="user__logo adobe"><img src=https://d33wubrfki0l68.cloudfront.net/82a75c13dac239bca6ef306f61b8fb5c2f7f0a98/26015/img/user-adobe.png alt="Adobe uses Browsersync"></div></div><div class=user__list><div class=user__person><img src=https://d33wubrfki0l68.cloudfront.net/65a7f80bf0758f14cc9df64a328912b74a697029/c8927/img/user-rupert-sm.jpg alt=""><div class=person__quote><p class=person__name>Dave Rupert</p><blockquote><p>Want to feel like a modern day demigod? Fire up Browsersync and control an entire device lab with your phone.</p></blockquote><p><a href="http://paravelinc.com/">Paravel</a> and <a href="http://shoptalkshow.com/">Shop Talk Show</a></p></div></div><div class=user__person><img src=https://d33wubrfki0l68.cloudfront.net/1835bb08ff3726c711b2b2628e7c2f8e68c10e2f/6345a/img/user-addy-sm.jpg alt=""><div class=person__quote><p class=person__name>Addy Osmani</p><blockquote><p>It has a fantastic feature-set and at least 5 developers I’ve spoken to this week alone swear by it for their own synchronized cross-device testing.</p></blockquote><p>Google and <a href="https://addyosmani.com/">addyosmani.com</a></p></div></div></div></div></section><section id=install class="wrapper install"><div class="container container--skinny"><h2 class=section-title>Get started in 5 minutes.</h2><p class=lede></p><ol class=step-list><li class=step><h3>1. Install Node.js</h3><p>Browsersync is a module for Node.js, a platform for fast network applications. There are convenient <a href="http://nodejs.org/download/">installers for MacOS, Windows and Linux</a>.</p></li><li class=step><h3>2. Install Browsersync</h3><p>The Node.js package manager (npm) is used to install Browsersync from <a href=https://npmjs.org/package/browser-sync>a repository</a>. Open a terminal window and run the following command:</p><pre><code>npm install -g browser-sync</code></pre><p>You’re telling the package manager to download the Browsersync files and install them globally so they’re available to all your projects.</p></li><li class=step><h3>3. Start Browsersync</h3><p>A basic use is to watch all CSS files in the <code>css</code> directory and update connected browsers if a change occurs. Navigate your terminal window to a project and run the appropriate command:</p><h4>Static sites</h4><p>If you’re only using <code>.html</code> files, you’ll need to use the <em>server mode</em>. Browsersync will start a mini-server and provide a URL to view your site.</p><pre><code>browser-sync start --server --files "css/*.css"</code></pre><h4>Dynamic sites</h4><p>If you’re already running a local server with PHP or similar, you’ll need to use the <em>proxy mode</em>. Browsersync will wrap your vhost with a proxy URL to view your site.</p><pre><code>browser-sync start --proxy "myproject.dev" --files "css/*.css"</code></pre></li></ol><div class=grid><div class="one-half text--center"><h3>User Guides</h3><ul class=nav><li><a href=/docs>Documentation</a></li><li><a href=/docs/command-line>Command line usage</a></li><li><a href=http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/browser-sync>Get help on Stack Overflow</a></li><li><a href=https://github.com/Browsersync/browser-sync/issues>Report issues on Github</a></li></ul></div><div class="one-half text--center"><h3>Integration Guides</h3><ul class=nav><li><a href=/docs/grunt>Grunt plugin</a></li><li><a href=/docs/gulp>Gulp integration</a></li><li><a href=/docs/api>API documentation</a></li><li><a href=/docs/options>Options documentation</a></li></ul></div></div></div></section></div><footer class="wrapper signup" role=contentinfo><div class=container><p class=signup__title>Reach out on Twitter or Github</p><div class=signup__links><a href=https://twitter.com/browsersync title="@Browsersync on Twitter"><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-twitter></use></svg></a> <a href=https://github.com/Browsersync/browser-sync title="Browsersync on Github"><svg class=svg-icon><use xmlns:xlink=http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink xlink:href=/img/icons/icons.svg#svg-github></use></svg></a></div></div></footer><div class=credit><div class=container><nav><ul class=site-nav><li class=nav__item><a href=/docs class=nav-link>Documentation</a></li><li class=nav__item><a href=/brand-assets class=nav-link>Brand Assets</a></li></ul></nav></div></div><div class=credit><div class=container><p class=prev><small>Previously supported by <a href="https://wearejh.com/">JH</a></small></p></div></div><script src=/js/app.min.js></script><link rel=stylesheet href="//fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Titillium+Web:400,400italic,700"></body></html>
